attributes.title: Stock count
attributes.description:
A stock take exercise was conducted on 7th March 2025 to assess the efficiency of the set controls.

·       The following were the stock findings;

Ø  Bread variance- (-31 loaves)

Ø  Utto- (-2.5 kg)

Ø  Polybags-  (+292 pieces)

Summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: Stock controls are effective and need to be maintained.

value: We will maintain
To be maintained
Bread shortfall of 910 loaves was reported in the previous audit stock count conducted on 1st Feb 2025.
Minimal variances are noted in most of the stock items indicating that stock controls are effective.

attributes.title: Cash verification
attributes.description:
·        Physical cash count was conducted on 7 March 2025 to verify if the branch cash was well maintained.

·        No material variances were noted on the spot-check day.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should ensure that patty cash records and balances are well maintained.

value: To be maintained
To be maintained
No variances was reported in the previous audit findins
·        The immaterial variance noted in cash office is an indication that   effective controls are in place.

attributes.title: Bread weight Check
attributes.description:
·        Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

·        800g white variety had high cases of underweight at 36% while other varieties had minimal cases of underweight.

·        The underweight samples were spread as follows; 400g BT- 02%, 400g Br- 04%, 600g W- 0%, 800g W- 36% and 800g Br- 0%.

The table below summarizes the findings
attributes.recommendation: Management should strengthened the overall weight controls to ensure that all bread produced conform to the standard weight

value: Cases of underweight noted was contributed by oven
We have involved KAF to rectify the issues with the oven
Minimal cases of underweight was reported in the previous audit findings
The presence of underweight bread expose the company to non-compliance issues.

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
·        The branch hired a total of 281 production workers over the audited period hence the expected production was 1,405 bags.

·        The actual production was 1,380 bags leading to a production shortfall of 25 bags.

·        Actual production efficiency was 4.9 bags per worker which is below the set limit.

Production efficiency
attributes.recommendation: ·        Management to improve on the planning of production workers to ensure that the set packaging efficiency is consistently achieved.

value: The drop in production efficiency was contributed by failure to achieve shift-wise targets and we are trying our best to ensure that the target is consistently achieved.
We have aligned the issues affecting the production efficiency and we expect to be within the range moving forward.
Production efficiency was not achieved in the previous audit findings.
The set production efficiency was not achieved indicating that the company incurred high production cost.

attributes.title: Packaging Efficiency
attributes.description:
·        The total bread produced over the audited period is 17,778 crates hence the expected slicers to be hired was 183 workers.

·        A total of 182 workers were hired leading to a packaging efficiency of 97.7 crates per worker which is within the range.

·        The set efficiency was achieved.

Table summary of the findings

Implication

The set production efficiency was not achieved indicating that the company incurred high production cost.
attributes.recommendation: ·        Management to ensure that the set packaging efficiency is consistently achieved.

value: Packaging efficiency was achieved.
To be maintained
The set efficiency was achieved as per the previous audit findings
The planned packaging cost was observed

attributes.title: Mixing chart analysis
attributes.description:
·        Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 01.02.25 – 06.03.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.

·        There was no material variance between system and the actual material usage.

·        No significant variance in bread posting was noted over the audited period.

Below are the summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: The branch should continue observing the set production standards.

value: ·        We will maintain.
To be maintained.
No variances was reported in the previous audit findings.
Production standards were observed.

·        The actual production was 1,380 bags leading to a production shortfall of 25 bags.

·        Actual production efficiency was 4.9 bags per worker which is below the set limit.

Production efficiency

attributes.title: Generator Fuel Purchase and usage
attributes.description:
·        Generator fuel purchase analysis was reviewed from Dec 2024 to Feb 2025 to assess the adequacy of company controls to safeguard company assets.

·        A review of fuel purchases revealed cases of unauthorized purchases similar to cases noted in motor vehicle fuel purchases.

·        163 litres of generator fuel worth Ksh.26,159 purchased in different dates between December and January was not received at the branch.

·        Over the reviewed period there were no security guard records of fuel deliveries at the branch creating a loophole for records manipulation.
attributes.recommendation:
1. Accounts should share fuel purchase records every month to the branch operation managers to track purchase records and help in assessing fuel usage efficiency. 

    2. Security guards at the entry should maintain records of all fuel deliveries to enhance accountability.

value: I will ensure accurate purchase records are kept.
discrepancies for February was noted and disciplinary action taken against the manager who was responsible for the malpractice
·       Misappropriation of 163 litres of generator fuel worth Ksh.26,159 is an indication that fuel purchase controls are weak and expose the company to losses.

attributes.title: Review of motor vehicle Fuel purchase and usage
attributes.description:
·        Analysis of motor vehicle fuel purchase and usage was done from Dec 2024 to Feb 2025 to assess compliance to company policies.

·        A review of fuel purchases revealed cases of unauthorized purchases where fuel was purchased without prior issuance of Local Purchase Orders (LPOs).

·        The fuel was not dispensed to the designated vehicle but was misappropriated by the then branch manager, Erickton Okumu was in-charge over the period reviewed.

·        180 litres of fuel purchased using a spare card designated for KCN 097M in different dates between January and February could not be accounted.

·        The misappropriated fuel amounted to Ksh. 28,784
attributes.recommendation:
Use of spare cards should be discouraged and only allowed when there is no better alternative and under strict controls. 

       All fuel purchases must be initiated by raising         an LPO at the branch. Accounts should                  thoroughly investigate inconsistencies                     identified during reconciliation.

value: The issues happened when the previous manager was in charge. I will ensure accountability and accuracy of records.
We will improve our overall controls regarding fuel purchases to ensure that the issues do not happen in future.
Unaccounted 180 litres of fuel worth Ksh. 28,784 is an indication of weak controls which expose the company to losses.
